intro: Matelea fontana, commonly known as the Fountainmatelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Matelea fontana is often found in desert or semi-arid environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
